description: Change of use of 27 flats (Class C3) to an apartment hotel (Class C1), construction of an entrance hall, lift, cycle and refuse store, installation of four roof lights and construction of fifth floor mansard to provide three additional units of accommodation.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): AC - 100 (location plan and existing site plan), AC - 201 B (existing ground floor plan), AC - 202 B (proposed ground floor plan), AC - 203 B (existing first floor plan), AC - 204 B (proposed first floor plan), AC - 205 B (existing second floor plan), AC - 206 B (proposed second floor plan), AC - 207 B (existing third floor plan), AC - 208 B (proposed third floor plan), AC - 209 B (existing fourth floor plan), AC - 210 B (proposed fourth floor plan), AC - 211 B (proposed fifth floor plan), AC - 212 B (existing roof plan), AC - 213 B (proposed roof plan), AC - 214 B (existing front elevation), AC - 215 B (proposed front elevation), AC - 216 B (existing side elevation), AC - 217 B (proposed side elevation), AC - 218 B (existing rear elevation), AC - 219 B (proposed rear elevation), AC - 220 B (existing side elevation), AC - 221 B (proposed side elevation), existing schedule of accommodation, Planning and Heritage Statement APL/00425/DOD prepared by Alpha Planning dated 05.12.2024.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).
| Refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on the approved plans shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2021) policy SI 7. | Cycle parking spaces should be provided within the bike store shown on the approved plans and shall be brought into use prior to first occupation of the development and retained permanently.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with Sustainable Transport SPG, policies T2, T3 and T5 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1(f) and 2.1(d) of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012). | Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays, in accordance with internal noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Best practicable mitigation measures shall also be implemented, as necessary, in external amenity spaces to achieve criteria of BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy D14 of The London Plan (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedspaces adjoining/above/ below multi-use bedsits, and of at least 10dB enhancement for habitable space below laundry room and adjoining the communal staircase and corridors. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy D14 of The London Plan (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation of lifts and lift shafts, in accordance with noise limits specified in Table 5 BS8233:2014. Details shall include mitigation measures and the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound/rating level. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy D14 of The London Plan (2021). | No person shall stay for a total of 90 consecutive days or greater in any calendar year of the development hereby approved. A log of persons staying at the hotel shall be maintained and shall be made available for inspection upon request by the local planning authority.

Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with policies 3B Ealing Development Management DPD(2013) and policy 1.1(b), 1.2(d) and 2.(c) of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework (core) Strategy(2012) and policies D6 and E10 of the London Plan(2021); and the NPPF(2024) section 12. | Prior to the first occupation of the development, a detailed Hotel Management Scheme shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing and include details of:
a. appointed hotel site manager/s
b. site security and fire safety procedures
c. check-in and check-out procedures
d. maintenance of internal and external areas
e. cleaning schedules
f.  measures and procedures to prevent and deal with antisocial behaviour and complaints
g. conduct and general house rules
The site shall be managed in accordance with the approved strategy for the life of the development or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interest of residential amenity in accordance with policy E10, D11 and D12 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012).
